The carbonyl group in cycloketones is ALWAYS number 1. IUPAC naming convention is to not place 1 unless there is at least also a ket-2-one--no such cycloketone. There are double cycloketones, but they are named differently (ie. 1,4-cyclohexadione)
/* Drug interactions */CiteCompletion, dates: 1, works/pubs: 1, titles: 1, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7654)
